Comment.value: send player to see elemental riddle golem.
player on stage two, not completed yet

The four items that you should find are: a bit of clay, a bit of kindling wood, a flask of water, and a puff of fog.

The player is told to get 4 rare items, all of which can be found by searching about the Cloaktower. None of these items require owners or dialogue associated with them. Kindling wood can be found in a fireplace, a flask of water can be found on any table, a bit of clay might be found in a small demon pit, and a puff of fog can be found in a room with potions that billow forth smoke. Each item is replaced with a wand - of Earth, Fire, Water, and Air respectively. The usage of these four wands in the proper order will disable the golem that the players must face. The golem is slow moving enough to allow moving players to keep their distance and prepare to use the wands.

The proper order is EARTH, AIR, WATER, FIRE.

As clues, descriptions on these items should make note of the following:

A Bit of Clay - [No Clues]

Kindling Wood - Carved upon this bit of kindling wood is the following phrase: "And the fire was angry, for while it could destroy the ground beneath it, it could not overcome the rain above. Such is the way of those which have come late in life."

A Flask of Water - Written on a piece of tape that is stretched across the flask: "For while the water should have generally been proud, having existed far longer than many of those within this world, it could not exist without a solid foundation to settle in upon - and for that, it remained humble."

A Puff of Fog - Written across this small package that holds within a bit of fog is the following message: "When air became, in its youth, jealous of its place in the world, it sought out ways to assert its power. It floated high in the night air, and obscured the view of the stars from those that lay beneath it. But soon it filled with water that became too heavy, and it came crashing down to rejoin with those who came before - an embrace that left it no longer uncertain of its place within the world."
